channel.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13
channel.description:
Huston I have a problem...
Host: Debian 8.5 KDE Guest : Whonix Gateway 13
Its been several hours I am trying to solve this but no success, tor circuit is not established suck at 45%. Clock is OK, whonixcheck debug command:
tor_consensus_status : verified current_time_in_valid_range: true
current_time_torish : 2016-08-09 12:28:36 tor_consensus_valid_after : 2016-08-09 12:00:00 tor_consensus_valid_until : 2016-08-09 15:00:00 tor_consensus_middle_range : 2016-08-09 13:30:00
tor_cert_lifetime_output : tor_cert_lifetime_valid : true tor_cert_valid_after :
I also checked size of images with du -h Whonix-Gateway-*.qcow2 showing around 4.5G.
I also properly run command - sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/TEMPLATE.qemu /etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/TEMPLATE.kvm just as indicated in wiki.
TBB works on Host. I even went ahead, installed TBB in another VM and that also works.
What should I do ? Do I need to change anything in '.xml' ? Haven't changed anything yet to avoid any conflicts.

item.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
It’s an important test, otherwise we cannot pinpoint the error. I don’t
see how clock sync is related.

Install the VPN on the host. Installing it in the gateway would probably
make things more complicated.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13

item.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13
item.dc:creator: mechanic
item.description:
This is the only thing I left because I dont want to reveal that I am a whonix user

Can I use vpn to test this but I think that would cause another problem - clock sync.

I will still go ahead and try that out with VPN.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Were the network tests on Whonix-Gateway as user clearnet ( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Troubleshooting#As_user_clearnet ) to connect to check.torproject.org functional?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: mechanic
item.description:
Yes I did that too from the very beginning without any positive results

Whenever debug command shows clock as false I use clock fix (set command), it becomes true but bootstrap still never exceed 45%.

item.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13
item.dc:creator: mechanic
item.description:
I did everything as indicated on troubleshooting page and everything was as it was suppose to be but I noticed one thing with clock, even if the clock is in the range whonixcheck debug command still sometimes shows false, sometimes true.
I can confirm that my PC’s clock is OK.
Tried on debian xfce as kde was giving some random lag but still the same results.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13

item.title: Whonixcheck stuck at 45% in whonix gateway 13

item.description:
Huston I have a problem…

Host: Debian 8.5 KDE
Guest : Whonix Gateway 13

Its been several hours I am trying to solve this but no success, tor circuit is not established suck at 45%. Clock is OK, whonixcheck debug command:

tor_consensus_status : verified
current_time_in_valid_range: true

current_time_torish : 2016-08-09 12:28:36
tor_consensus_valid_after : 2016-08-09 12:00:00
tor_consensus_valid_until : 2016-08-09 15:00:00
tor_consensus_middle_range : 2016-08-09 13:30:00

tor_cert_lifetime_output :

showing around 4.5G.

I also properly run command - sudo ln -s /etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/TEMPLATE.qemu /etc/apparmor.d/libvirt/TEMPLATE.kvm just as indicated in wiki.

TBB works on Host. I even went ahead, installed TBB in another VM and that also works.

What should I do ? Do I need to change anything in ‘.xml’ ?
Haven’t changed anything yet to avoid any conflicts.
